meaningMnemonic: The <radical>root</radical> of a <radical>stamp</radical> is to get an <kanji>instant</kanji> picture down. Back in the olden days, people had to make seals and draw out things by hand, so stamps came about so you can—BAM—just stamp it and have what you want in an instant.
readingMnemonic: Think about the thing you want to make <kanji>instant</kanji>. I'd want instant <reading>sock</reading>s (そく)! Don't waste time searching for a matching pair or pulling them on. Just take out a pair of instant socks, add water, and the socks are already on your feet. In an instant!
